page.title: 18Transport
page.content: The main railway line is controlled by two signal boxes. The line is now electified. Three Bridges now has a computerised system. There is a big screen where you can chart up trains and see where they are. They can chart up trains from Norwood Junction to Brighton. Other stations can send messages through a Telex machine. There was abig dashboard with lots of buttons. There was a recorded message button but if that went wrong someone could speak through a microphone. The indicator board tells you what trains are coming and going and where they are stopping. The man let Edward speak through a micreophone and I pressed a button to start a recorded message. I thought it was great fun. Mark Evans Age 9
